title: Champion Mastery points should be given for actual skill, not for victory
body: I think that it's unfair when one person can feed the whole game and somehow, by achieving victory, get much more points than someone who has been trying to win the match from the opposite team with a good or dramatically better k/d/a ratio. I mean, it's **not** Champion Mastery then - it's something what just goes along with your Wins/Loses ratio and just tells how long have you been wining the games. Wouldn't it be much better if you were actually rewarded for your efforts, even if you have lost the match? Wouldn't it actually show the true meaning of a graceful defeat?

replies.body: You aren't mastering a champion if you don't use it to win the game.

And what if the player has the best k/d/a in the game and he's the only one who's trying to do something, while all his team feeds? He loses the game and he gets nothing, his efforts to win not only his own lane, but to save everybody were just a waste of time?

Usually (not always) if someone has a great KDA and they lose, it means that they were too busy helping themselves and not their team.

The goal of the game is to kill the nexus, not have a high KDA.

This.

I know people want to brag about their kda and how everyone else is a feeder, but this game is about objectives, not kills. Kills *help,* but they are not the only factor and when people focus solely on KDA and nothing else, the entire point of something like champion mastery is lost on them.

while my entire team managed to rack up scores like 1/8, 0/6 etc. all 4 of them. before i could even put my advantage to use to help them. there are sometimes these games that get thrown by that 1 lee sin who thinks hes a big shot and tries to dive 1v5 then gets killed. or some people having the strategic understanding of a rotten potato and walk right into a clearly visible ambush instead away from it and throw the game for your entire team.

That's garbage.  How about this:
What if I have a game where the teams are even EXCEPT I'm best on my team and the opposing team has someone that is flat out BETTER than me.  Ignoring all the troll games, afks, dcs and whatnot (that happen ALL THE TIME), it is fairly reasonable to say if you believe in Riot's matchmaking abilities that I'm gonna be close to 50/50 simply because I SHOULD be playing on even ground. (opponent is equal or SLIGHTLY better/worse than me)  In that scenario, I can play perfectly, help the team as best I can but still LOSE, but NOT because I'm not playing my champion well, but simply because someone else is BETTER.  Just to use an extreme, If I'm gold quality and he's plat quality and EVERYONE else playing is bronze, how is it fair that plat's bronzies get a ton more Mastery Pts than me simply because they got lucky placement?
Why is everyone ignoring the word "usually?"

> [{quoted}](name=13ennetto,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mcF1QHw8,comment-id=00000001000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-13T14:18:05.639+0000)
>
> Why is everyone ignoring the word "usually?"

ASSUMING Riot's matchmaking is correct, any player SHOULD lose 50% (give or take) of the time because he's playing against EVEN competition.  Whether that is because One player is great and the other 4 are terrible, or all 5 are average or some variation in between, the fact (again, assuming you believe in the system) is that IF you are playing "correctly" you're going to win about half of your games (or you will be promoted).  With that in mind, how is it "USUALLY" that you would be playing "wrong" if you lose while playing well?

As a side note, to bring it back to the original point about mastery pts vs. game result.  Forget all that nonsense, FORGET the "top" end.  Let's instead focus on the BOTTOM end.  Let's say someone with "S" rank and insane (think 24-0-6, made up numbers btw) KDA deserves to only get 250 Mastery Pts because his team lost.  Fine, great, whatever.  You can't carry or rally the team, you suck, rah rah.  This isn't a question ABOUT him, what about the 0-15-3 MIDDLE laner that got carried by a god-like bot duo and an out of his mind Jungler, with an average Top.  Does THAT guy deserve 1000+ Mastery Pts just because he was "on the right team"?  Someone who has crap tier mechanics and is always caught out of position, but just "right place, right time" so pts for you.  THAT is appropriate?

I ask because I've BEEN that latter guy in games.  I've had games where I KNOW I sucked.  I played TERRIBLE, I wasn't last hitting at all, I didn't group well, I got caught in bad places, long story short, I played awful by all conceivable metrics, but you know what, my TEAM still won (I didn't **intentionally** feed or AFK, so I had that going for me).  I would prefer a need to grind my way to being top flight with my champion and know that Mastery actually MEANS I know what I'm doing (both to others, and also to MYSELF) rather than get carried to top rank just to give myself a participation ribbon.

My answer is yes.  The 0/15/3 guy that his team carried him to a win deserves more mastery points than the 24/0/6 guy on the losing team because the first guy's team won.  Simple as that.  You should never be rewarded for being on a losing team.  I'll say that again.  You should never be rewarded for being on a losing team.  You can have more points than the other players on your team, sure.  But in the end, you lost.  The point of the game is not to get kills.  Farming kills is worthless if you don't use it to your advantage.

It doesn't matter how good you are, you're still going to lose a whole lot. There is no way around that unless you're an established, organized team with a group philosophy of how to go about things, which varies in solo queue and requires personal adjustment. Accommodating other players and how they go about things in the games you share is an integral part of the game.

This is a basic aspect of League that so few people get, it's almost overwhelming. What part of "team game" is confusing everyone? What part of "it isn't first to 50 kills" are people not understanding? There are no individual victories. None. It doesn't exist in the game.

Because you didn't destroy the nexus.  All that doesn't matter if you don't destroy the nexus.

The goal of the champion mastery feature wasn't supposed to be another version of ranked, because you know, we have ranked.

Instead it's more about champion affinity. If you want to proclaim to the world that you are a Syndra main, or you really love Volibear, or you've played a shit ton of Akali, you can communicate that through champ mastery. Because League is a competitive game and the never-ending path to mastery is one of our [design values](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/features/dev-blog-design-values-league-legends) we did want to incorporate skill as part of the feature, but it's not the entire feature.

I'd never argue against winning factoring in because that opens the door to more self-focused behavior patterns rather than team/game-focused one.  And I know the exact ratio used is more or less moot from a numbers perspective because it matters more how things average out in the long term than from game to game.  However...the current balance **feels** too dramatically skewed, much like the first version of Party IP.  I could be way off due to limited sample size, but it seems like you receive around 0-300 mastery points based on performance and then +1000 or +0 points depending on if your team won or not.  Of course you want the victory reward to be high enough to incentivize good behavior, but hopefully you can understand people's frustration when a poor performer or even troll on a winning team is _guaranteed_ over _three times_ as many "mastery points" as you for even the best personal performance of your life during a losing game.
As a side note, I think this same argument applies to MMR gains and I agree with it entirely.

Hey there,

Totally understand that there's some dissonance here when you get back to back results like this.

When we're working on design and balance here we have a range of factors. Most importantly, we want games to stay healthy competitive environments where everyone is trying to do the same thing (namely: win.)

We don't want people off farming lanes while the team is doing Baron, or trying to steal kills, or any other weird behavior that's focusing on min-maxing Champ Mastery rather than winning the game. For this reason, your champion points are based on your overall team's performance. We'll keep looking at the specific balancing and see if it needs tweaking.

We also want to be able to give you feedback on how well you're doing, and that's what we have the performance grades for - S through D. They compare how well you did in the game with everyone else in your region on that Champion and position (e.g. Rek'Sai jungle).

Giving goals and feedback based on individual performance is a really interesting space that we may well move in to in future - we just have to be really careful about how we do it. Suggestions are welcome! :)

Doesn't change the fact that champion mastery should be about how well you do with a champion, not whether you win or lose. I shouldn't get more points winning with a C champion than I get losing with an S champion. That just doesn't make any sense.

Riot could very easily make the system reward actual skill. The system could look at kill participation, turret damage, dragon/baron involvement, etc. Players  can't abuse the system if they don't know what factors are most important.
